text: Elcam Medical Disposable Pressure Transducer is indicated for pressure sensing during clinically invasive procedures without interfering with the patient’s blood flow and/or blood pressure. It has two main types - Straight and Integrated.

Elcam Medical's Disposable Pressure Transducer (DPT) is indicated for patients requiring intravascular, intracranial, abdominal and intrauterine pressure monitoring. It comprises a sensor מ1‎ fluid communication with different body fluids. By hydraulic connection the pressure is transferred to the sensing unit, which translates it ס?‎ an electrical signal. It 15 connected by a cable, that can have various connectors, to the monitor.

Elcam Medical's Disposable Integrated Pressure Transducer (DIPT) is intended for direct measurement and monitoring ?ס‎ blood pressure. It comprises a blood pressure sensor, a flush device, and a stopcock all molded as a single piece. The sensor is in hydraulic connection with the blood stream 50 that סחז‎ patient’s pulse can be translated to an electrical signal. The flush device allows continuous low flow when at rest and ה‎ high flow required for flushing blood from the monitoring line when operated. The stopcock is used for zeroing the pressure monitor before operation. It also assists מ1‎ blood sampling procedures. It 15 connected by a cable, that can have various connectors, to the monitor.

This document contains a post-factum information on Risk analysis, Evaluation and Control for the DPT & DIPT. In order to identify the risks, Production and post production Information was gathered: from customers complaints, inner manufacturing problems, Engineering opinion and manufacturing personnals opinion.
This document contains a post-factum information on Risk analysis, Evaluation and Control for the DPT & DIPT.

This document contains the Risk Analysis, Risk Evaluation and Risk Control of the DPT &DIPT. The purpose of this document is to identify and minimize risks involved in the design, Use and manufacturing using FMEA (Failure mode & Effect Analysis) method by calculating RPN value (Risk Priority Number), evaluated by the severity, probability and detectability (the rank is described in the "Scale" worksheet).
The DIPT and DPT's development projects have ended and the product is in its production and post production lifecycle phase.

Hazardous Situation - Circumstances in which people, property or environment are exposed to one or more potential source(s) of harm. Cause(s) of Failure - the engineering reason(s) to cause hazardous situation.
Failure Type - classification of the failure Mode whether it 18 random עס‎ systematic Failure.
Effect of the failure - potential harm to the user, patient or environment or effect on image עס‎ manufacturing.
Potential Effect of the failure - potential harm to the user, patient or environment or effect on image עס‎ manufacturing. RPN - Risk Priority number. RPN=Severity*Probability*Detectability.
Mitigation Activity - an activity to reduce the RPN number to the minimum possible.
ALARP/AFAP - As Low As Reasonably Possible/As Far as Possible. risk rated as ALARP/AFAP must be mitigated.

The Risk Management Process is performed according to ISO 14971:2007 and BS EN ISO 14971:2012 using the FMEA method. The FMEA method is described in the Risk Management Plan Nov 19, 2008. The scales and the acceptance criteria appears in that document as well.
The scales for probability, Detectability and severity ratings appears 8180 in the "scale" worksheet.

text: In revision A of this document 36 risks were identified using the risk analysis described. 25 of which were rated to have RPN in the Acceptable region and 11 in the ALARP region.
Mitigation activities to reduce these risks were implemented in the past and can be find in Elcam SOPs.
revision B 8 additional risks were added (no. 11,13,14,17,18,36,37,38). All the risks were rated according to the scales and RPN value was‏ מ1 calculated.
11 risks have RPN in the ALARP region and 33 are acceptable risks according to their RPN value.
Mitigation activities were signed for all of the risks together with the responsibility.
In revision C there is no change in RPN levels and mitigations.
Risk to benefit analysis: The design is verifiyed & the product is successfully validated. QC inspections are set ס1‎ asure good functioning products in the market.
The benefit of the DPT and DIPT outweighs the risks.
Next stage of Risk Management review: Rutine review of this document.

Date: 5.1. Revision History Tracking: Revision 0- first release Revision A- New format, Reveiwed and Updated Revision B- New format, adding risks no. 11,13,14,17,18,36-38, Review and reevaluation Dec 18" 2014 Revision C- General format updates, Review and reevaluation
